ifm_schema.description: Common interface management. It includes the public configuration of interfaces.

statistic-interval.description: Set the interval at which global flow statistics are collected.

ipv4-ignore-primary-sub.description: Enable/disable the function of ignoring primary/secondary of IPv4 address type. All secondary addresses must be deleted before this function is enabled.

sub-interface-link-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on all Sub-interface.

damp.description: Enable/disable suppression on interfaces' physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable interfaces from sending signals if the interfaces' physical status flappings are suppressed.

auto-recovery-times.description: List of automatic recovery time configuration.

time-value.description: Delay for the status transition from down to up.

interfaces.description: List of configuring information on an interface.

interface.description: Configure information on an interface. Physical, NULL, Virtual-if, and Virtual-Template0 interfaces cannot be created or deleted.

name.description: The textual name of the interface. It should be the name of the interface as assigned by the local device. It should be suitable for use in commands which entered at the device's 'console'. This might be a text name, such as 'NULL0', depending on the interface naming syntax of the device.

class.description: Identify a main interface or a sub-interface.

type.description: Type of an interface. Interfaces include physical and logical interfaces.

parent-name.description: Name of the main interface. For example, Ethernet0/1/0.

number.description: Number of an interface. For example,1, 0/1/0, or 2:1.

admin-status.description: Administrative status of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-protocol.description: Link protocol. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

router-type.description: Route attribute of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

clear-ip-df.description: Enable/disable a device to forcibly fragment IP packets on an outbound interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-up-down-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable the statistics function on an interface. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-mode.description: Mode of statistics collection. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-type.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth-mbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-kbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.
Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mtu.description:
Maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface types.
Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the MTU value of main interface to subinterface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-interval.description: Interval at which flow statistics are collected on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

vrf-name.description: Name of a VPN instance. It uniquely identifies a VPN instance. The VRF name of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

l2-mode-enable.description: Enable/disable the function of creating an L2 Sub-interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mac-address.description: Config MAC Address. Constraints on MAC address configuration varies according to interfaces. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

position.description: Position of an interface. For example, 0/1/0. Data can be queried only on physical interfaces.

is-l2-switch.description: To identify a layer2 switch port.

vs-name.description: Name of a VS to which an interface belongs.

l2-switch-port-index.description: L2 switch port index of an interface.

protocol-up-delay-time.description: Specify the protocol up-delay-time value in seconds.

control-flap.description: Enable/disable flapping control on an interface.

suppress.description: Suppression threshold on an interface. The value must be greater than the reusing threshold and smaller than the suppression upper limit.

reuse.description: Reusing threshold of an interface. The value must be smaller than the suppression threshold.

ceiling.description: Maximum suppression value on an interface. The value should be greater than the damping suppression threshold.

decay-ok.description: The penalty value of an Up interface attenuates to 1/2.

decay-ng.description: The penalty value of a Down interface attenuates to 1/2.

control-flap-count.description: Status suppression count of an interface.

ignore-damp.description: Configure an interface to ignore the global damp-interface function.

ignore-global-damp.description: Enable/disable an interface to ignore the global damp-interface function.

tunnel-protocol.description:
Configure tunnel protocol.
Special explanation:
Constraint: If a tunnel is locked, all configurations of the tunnel cannot be deleted or modified.

address.description: The IPv4 address can be specified as negotiated or unnumbered or ordinarily address.

static-arp.description: Configure static ARP table. By default, the system ARP table is empty, and address mappings are obtained using dynamic ARP.

ip-addr.description: IP address specified in this command and the IP address of the outbound interface specified by interface must be on the same network segment.

mac-addr.description: MAC address specified in this command and can not be a broadcast address.

pevid.description: Outer VLAN ID. If this parameter is not set, the VLAN ID is considered to be 0. If this parameter is set, the ARP entry is in the specified VLAN. Please be consistent with the VLAN configuration on the interface.

cevid.description: Inner VLAN ID. If this parameter is not set, the VLAN ID is considered to be 0. If this parameter is set, the ARP entry is in the specified VLAN. Please be consistent with the VLAN configuration on the interface.

ipv6.description: Enable/disable the IPv6 capability on an interface.

mtu6.description:
IPv6 maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface's type.

prefix-length.description: Length of the IPv6 address prefix.

trans-vlans.description: List of VLAN IDs of received packets. VLANs are used to control traffic access. Only one VLAN can be configured on an interface and all its sub-interfaces.

vlans.description: VLAN list. The specified VLAN must have been added to an interface.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable VLAN group-based QinQ packet statistics.

flow-type.description: Specify an encapsulation type. After an encapsulation type is specified, it cannot be changed to another encapsulation type. In addition, it can not be deleted if a service has been configured in the same interface. If an encapsulation type fails to be specified, see the error message to determine the failure cause.

vlan-type-vid.description: VLAN ID of the VLAN sub-interface;

dot1q-vlans.description: List of dot1q termination configuration. When tag-type is rt-protocol, this node can only configure one VLAN.

vlan-list.description: Dot1q termination VLAN ID list.
Dot1q termination VLAN ID list. The VLAN in VLAN-list can not exist in the VLAN-list of dot1q-VLANs-group.

policy-vlan-groups.description: List of sub-interface policy VLAN with gorup.

vrrps.description: Configure dot1q VRRP list. VLAN-id must be configured on the interface.

pwtag.description: Configure the P-Tag of the packets in the PW with VLAN.

tag.description: Tag type, include local switching, rt-protocol and none type, this value can not be merged.

remark-type.description: Trust the 802.1p in the outer VLAN tag, inner VLAN tag, or user-defined precedence.

user-mode.description: Enable or disable the user mode.

group-id.description: Specified VLAN group ID. The group-id cannot be modified after the qinq-vid is created.

pwtag.description: Configure the P-Tag of the packets in the PW with VLAN.

mapping-vids.description: List of QinQ mapping VLAN ID.

mapping-vlan-id.description: VLAN ID after VLAN mapping is performed.

vlan-type-vid.description: VLAN ID of the VLAN sub-interface.

policy-vlan-groups.description: List of sub-interface policy VLAN with gorup.

dscp-values.description: DSCP policy value. The dscp-values ranges of different sub-interfaces on the same main interface cannot overlap.

user-vlan-qinqs.description: List of user VLAN QinQ configuration.

vlan-list.description: User VLAN dot1q VLAN ID list.

descriptions.description: List of user VLAN dot1q description.

local-switch.description: Enable/disable local switching on a sub-interface for QinQ VLAN tag termination.

vlan-list.description: VLAN list.

vlan-id-begin.description: Start VLAN ID in the user packet.

vlan-id-end.description: End VLAN ID in the user packet.

qinq-vid-ce-default.description: Configure QinQ encapsulation. The CE VLAN ID is not specified.

qinq-with-pe-segments.description: List of QinQ encapsulation with PE VLAN segment.

qinq-with-pe-segment.description: Configure QinQ encapsulation with PE VLAN segment.

flow-action.description: Configure packet rewriting information. If the interface is bound to a BD, this node cannot be modified.

offset-value.description: Offset value of the modified VLAN.

damping-time.description: Delay time after which a BDIF interface goes down.

trunk.description: Configure the trunk bundling technology that bundles multiple physical interfaces into a logical interface.

min-up-num.description: Specify the minimum number of Up member links of a trunk interface.

min-up-bandwidth.description: Specify the minimum bandwidth of Up member links of a trunk interface.

max-up-num.description: Maximum number of links that affect the actual bandwidth of the Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface.

type.description: Specify the trunk interface types. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types.

hash-type.description: Configure the hash algorithm for a forwarding table.

work-mode.description: Configure the working mode for a trunk interface.

smart-link-flush-vlan.description: Specify the ID of the VLAN to which Smart-link flush packets are sent. Only Layer 2 interface supports the node.

inactive-port-shutdown.description:
Enable/disable the laser auto shutdown function on the backup interface of the Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode.
After this function is enabled, the backup interface will be shut down. By default, the laser auto shutdown function is disabled.

preempt-enable.description:
Enable/disable delay switchback for the master member interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode. By default, this function is disabled. This function works together with revert delay time that can be configured only after this function is enabled.
After this function is enabled, the restored master interface automatically takes over traffic of the backup interface when the revert delay time expires.

preempt-delay-minutes.description:
Specify the delay interval (in minutes) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-seconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-milliseconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in million-seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

up-member-num.description: Specify the number of member interfaces in the Up state.

online-member-num.description: Specify the number of member interfaces in the Online state.

member-num.description: Specify the number of trunk member interfaces.

max-bandwidth.description: Specify the maximum bandwidth of a trunk interface.

member_name.description: Configure the name of a trunk member interface.

weight.description: Set the weight for a trunk member interface.

status.description: Display the status of a trunk member interface.

is-master.description: Enable/disable a trunk member interface as the master interface.

role.description: Display the role of a trunk member interface.

forwardings.description: List of the trunk forwarding table.

forwarding.description: Operational data of the trunk forwarding table.

id.description: ID of a trunk forwarding item.

master-port.description: Specify the name of the master interface in the trunk forwarding table.

slave-port.description: Specify the name of the slave interface in the trunk forwarding table.

arp-entry.description: Configure ARP interface, including the aging time, probe interval, number of aging probe attempts, dynamic ARP learning status, strict ARP learning status, and routed proxy.

expire-time.description: Aging time of a dynamic ARP entry.

probe-interval.description: Interval for detecting dynamic ARP entries.

probe-times.description: Number of aging probe attempts for a dynamic ARP entry. If a device does not receive an ARP reply message after the number of aging probe attempts reaches a specified number, the dynamic ARP entry is deleted.

arp-learn-disable.description: Enable/disable dynamic ARP learning. If the value is true, dynamic ARP learning is disabled. If the value is false, dynamic ARP learning is enabled.

arp-learn-strict.description: Enable strict ARP learning. After strict ARP learning is enabled, a device only learns address information of only the ARP reply message in response to the ARP request sent by itself. Strict ARP learning employs the longest match rule. 1)If strict ARP learning is configured both globally and in the interface, the strict ARP learning configuration in the interface is used. 2)If strict ARP learning is not configured in the interface, the global strict ARP learning configuration is used.

route-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable routed proxy ARP. When two hosts reside on different network segments and do not have default gateways configured, IP address resolution between the two hosts can be implemented using routed proxy ARP.

inner-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable intra-VLAN proxy ARP. Some switches isolate hosts in the same VLAN. To allow hosts in the same VLAN to communicate, enable inner VLAN proxy ARP.

inter-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable inter VLAN proxy ARP. If hosts in different VLANs need to communicate at L2, enable inter VLAN proxy ARP on an interface. Hosts between sub VLANs in a super VLAN cannot communicate by default. To allow these hosts to communicate, enable inter VLAN proxy ARP on the VLAN interface of the super VLAN.

local-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable local proxy ARP. To allow isolated hosts in a bridge domain (BD) to communicate with each other, enable local proxy ARP. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

fake-expire-time.description: Aging time of a fake ARP entry.

probe-unicast.description: Enable/disable to send unicast ARP aging probe messages for a dynamic ARP entry.

dest-mac-check.description: Enable/disable to check destination MAC addresses in ARP messages.

src-mac-check.description: Enable/disable to check source MAC addresses in ARP messages.

distribute-enable.description: Enable/disable to distribute gateway. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

gratuitous-send.description: Enable/disable to send gratuitous ARP packet on interface.

host-collect-enable.description: Enable/disable the host information collection function. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

anyway-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable anyway proxy ARP. When two hosts reside on different network segments and do not have default gateways configured, IP address resolution between the two hosts can be implemented using anyway proxy ARP.

generate-rdtbl-enable.description: Enable/disable the configuration of generate rd table. It's mutually exclusive with the configuration of enable L2 proxy under the corresponding BD instance.

broadcast-detect-interval.description: Configure the broadcast detect interval. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

broadcast-detect-times.description: Configure the broadcast detect times. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

broadcast-detect-enable.description: Enable/disable the configuration of broadcast detect. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

fake-penalty-time.description: Aging penalty time of a fake ARP entry.

gratuitous-arp-drop.description: Enable/disable an interface to discard gratuitous ARP packets.

broadcast-max-num.description: Maximum broadcast packet sending rate, expressed in the number of packets sent per second.

smart-discover-enable.description: Enable/disable ARP smart discover. Only VLANIF interfaces are supported.

l2-sub-interface.description: Configure ARP security configuration on Layer 2 sub-interface.

l2proxy-dyn-learn.description: Enable/disable dynamic ARP learning of L2 proxy ARP.

l2proxy-max-num.description: Maximum number of ARP entries allowed for L2 proxy ARP.

ipv4-interface-count.description: Statistics of interfaces supporting IPv4 address configuration.

physical-up-count.description: Number of IPv4 interfaces that are in the physical up state.

physical-down-count.description: Number of IPv4 interfaces that are in the physical down state.

protocol-up-count.description: Number of IPv4 interfaces that are in the protocol up state.

protocol-down-count.description: Number of IPv4 interfaces that are in the protocol down state.

remote-interfaces.description: List of statistics of remote interfaces.

last-cleared-time.description: Last time when statistics about remote interfaces were cleared.

in-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are received.

in-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are received.

in-peak-bit-rate.description: Peak rate at which bits are received.

in-peak-bit-rate-record-time.description: Time when the peak bit receive rate is reached.

out-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are sent.

out-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are sent.

out-peak-bit-rate.description: Peak rate at which bits are sent.

out-peak-bit-rate-record-time.description: Time when the peak bit send rate is reached.

strict-learn-enable.description: Enable/disable strict ARP learning so that a device learns only address information carried in the ARP reply messages in response to the ARP Request messages sent by itself.

l2topo-detect-enable.description: Enable/disable L2 topology probe. After a L2 interface goes up, the device updates all ARP entries corresponding to the VLAN to which the L2 interface belongs.

rate-trap-interval.description: Interval at which ARP logs and traps are recorded. If the value is 0, logs and traps are not recorded.

passive-learn-enable.description: Enable/disable passive ARP learning. After the backup device in a VRRP backup group receives an ARP request message destined for the virtual IP address, the backup device learns the ARP entry of the requester.

con-send-enable.description: Enable/disable ARP packet sending at a limited rate.

con-send-maxnum.description: Maximum packet sending rate, expressed in the number of packets send every 10 ms.

gratuitous-drop.description: Enable/disable the function to discard gratuitous ARP packets.

vlanif-expiretime.description: Aging time of a dynamic ARP entry of VLAN interface.

host-conflict-period.description: Period configurations for the host conflict.

host-conflict-threshold.description: Retry times configurations for the host conflict.

smart-discover-interval.description: Set the interval for sending ARP probe packets.

smart-discover-count.description: Set the number of ARP probe packets sent in each interval. The count is an integer that ranges from 1 to 512 with the step of 8. For example, the value can be 1, 8, 16.

trunk.description: Configure the trunk bundling technology that bundles multiple physical interfaces into a logical interface.

min-up-bandwidth.description: Specify the minimum bandwidth of Up member links of a trunk interface.

max-up-num.description: Maximum number of links that affect the actual bandwidth of the Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface.

type.description: Specify the trunk interface types. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types.

hash-type.description: Configure the hash algorithm for a forwarding table.

work-mode.description: Configure the working mode for a trunk interface.

inactive-port-shutdown.description:
Enable/disable the laser auto shutdown function on the backup interface of the Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode.
After this function is enabled, the backup interface will be shut down. By default, the laser auto shutdown function is disabled.

preempt-enable.description:
Enable/disable delay switchback for the master member interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode. By default, this function is disabled. This function works together with revert delay time that can be configured only after this function is enabled.
After this function is enabled, the restored master interface automatically takes over traffic of the backup interface when the revert delay time expires.

preempt-delay-minutes.description:
Specify the delay interval (in minutes) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-seconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-milliseconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in million-seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

status.description: Display the status of a trunk member interface.

is-master.description: Enable/disable a trunk member interface as the master interface.

role.description: Display the role of a trunk member interface.

forwardings.description: List of the trunk forwarding table.

arp-entry.description: Configure ARP interface, including the aging time, probe interval, number of aging probe attempts, dynamic ARP learning status, strict ARP learning status, and routed proxy.

expire-time.description: Aging time of a dynamic ARP entry.

probe-interval.description: Interval for detecting dynamic ARP entries.

probe-times.description: Number of aging probe attempts for a dynamic ARP entry. If a device does not receive an ARP reply message after the number of aging probe attempts reaches a specified number, the dynamic ARP entry is deleted.

arp-learn-disable.description: Enable/disable dynamic ARP learning. If the value is true, dynamic ARP learning is disabled. If the value is false, dynamic ARP learning is enabled.

arp-learn-strict.description: Enable strict ARP learning. After strict ARP learning is enabled, a device only learns address information of only the ARP reply message in response to the ARP request sent by itself. Strict ARP learning employs the longest match rule. 1)If strict ARP learning is configured both globally and in the interface, the strict ARP learning configuration in the interface is used. 2)If strict ARP learning is not configured in the interface, the global strict ARP learning configuration is used.

route-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable routed proxy ARP. When two hosts reside on different network segments and do not have default gateways configured, IP address resolution between the two hosts can be implemented using routed proxy ARP.

inner-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable intra-VLAN proxy ARP. Some switches isolate hosts in the same VLAN. To allow hosts in the same VLAN to communicate, enable inner VLAN proxy ARP.

inter-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable inter VLAN proxy ARP. If hosts in different VLANs need to communicate at L2, enable inter VLAN proxy ARP on an interface. Hosts between sub VLANs in a super VLAN cannot communicate by default. To allow these hosts to communicate, enable inter VLAN proxy ARP on the VLAN interface of the super VLAN.

local-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable local proxy ARP. To allow isolated hosts in a bridge domain (BD) to communicate with each other, enable local proxy ARP. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

fake-expire-time.description: Aging time of a fake ARP entry.

probe-unicast.description: Enable/disable to send unicast ARP aging probe messages for a dynamic ARP entry.

dest-mac-check.description: Enable/disable to check destination MAC addresses in ARP messages.

src-mac-check.description: Enable/disable to check source MAC addresses in ARP messages.

distribute-enable.description: Enable/disable to distribute gateway. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

gratuitous-send.description: Enable/disable to send gratuitous ARP packet on interface.

host-collect-enable.description: Enable/disable the host information collection function. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

anyway-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable anyway proxy ARP. When two hosts reside on different network segments and do not have default gateways configured, IP address resolution between the two hosts can be implemented using anyway proxy ARP.

generate-rdtbl-enable.description: Enable/disable the configuration of generate rd table. It's mutually exclusive with the configuration of enable L2 proxy under the corresponding BD instance.

broadcast-detect-interval.description: Configure the broadcast detect interval. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

broadcast-detect-times.description: Configure the broadcast detect times. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

broadcast-detect-enable.description: Enable/disable the configuration of broadcast detect. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

fake-penalty-time.description: Aging penalty time of a fake ARP entry.

gratuitous-arp-drop.description: Enable/disable an interface to discard gratuitous ARP packets.

broadcast-max-num.description: Maximum broadcast packet sending rate, expressed in the number of packets sent per second.

smart-discover-enable.description: Enable/disable ARP smart discover. Only VLANIF interfaces are supported.

l2-sub-interface.description: Configure ARP security configuration on Layer 2 sub-interface.

l2proxy-dyn-learn.description: Enable/disable dynamic ARP learning of L2 proxy ARP.

l2proxy-max-num.description: Maximum number of ARP entries allowed for L2 proxy ARP.

damping-time.description: Delay time after which a BDIF interface goes down.

trunk.description: Configure the trunk bundling technology that bundles multiple physical interfaces into a logical interface.

min-up-num.description: Specify the minimum number of Up member links of a trunk interface.

min-up-bandwidth.description: Specify the minimum bandwidth of Up member links of a trunk interface.

max-up-num.description: Maximum number of links that affect the actual bandwidth of the Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface.

type.description: Specify the trunk interface types. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types.

hash-type.description: Configure the hash algorithm for a forwarding table.

work-mode.description: Configure the working mode for a trunk interface.

smart-link-flush-vlan.description: Specify the ID of the VLAN to which Smart-link flush packets are sent. Only Layer 2 interface supports the node.

inactive-port-shutdown.description:
Enable/disable the laser auto shutdown function on the backup interface of the Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode.
After this function is enabled, the backup interface will be shut down. By default, the laser auto shutdown function is disabled.

preempt-enable.description:
Enable/disable delay switchback for the master member interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode. By default, this function is disabled. This function works together with revert delay time that can be configured only after this function is enabled.
After this function is enabled, the restored master interface automatically takes over traffic of the backup interface when the revert delay time expires.

preempt-delay-minutes.description:
Specify the delay interval (in minutes) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-seconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-milliseconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in million-seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

up-member-num.description: Specify the number of member interfaces in the Up state.

online-member-num.description: Specify the number of member interfaces in the Online state.

member-num.description: Specify the number of trunk member interfaces.

max-bandwidth.description: Specify the maximum bandwidth of a trunk interface.

member_name.description: Configure the name of a trunk member interface.

weight.description: Set the weight for a trunk member interface.

status.description: Display the status of a trunk member interface.

is-master.description: Enable/disable a trunk member interface as the master interface.

role.description: Display the role of a trunk member interface.

forwardings.description: List of the trunk forwarding table.

forwarding.description: Operational data of the trunk forwarding table.

id.description: ID of a trunk forwarding item.

master-port.description: Specify the name of the master interface in the trunk forwarding table.

slave-port.description: Specify the name of the slave interface in the trunk forwarding table.

arp-entry.description: Configure ARP interface, including the aging time, probe interval, number of aging probe attempts, dynamic ARP learning status, strict ARP learning status, and routed proxy.

expire-time.description: Aging time of a dynamic ARP entry.

probe-interval.description: Interval for detecting dynamic ARP entries.

probe-times.description: Number of aging probe attempts for a dynamic ARP entry. If a device does not receive an ARP reply message after the number of aging probe attempts reaches a specified number, the dynamic ARP entry is deleted.

arp-learn-disable.description: Enable/disable dynamic ARP learning. If the value is true, dynamic ARP learning is disabled. If the value is false, dynamic ARP learning is enabled.

arp-learn-strict.description: Enable strict ARP learning. After strict ARP learning is enabled, a device only learns address information of only the ARP reply message in response to the ARP request sent by itself. Strict ARP learning employs the longest match rule. 1)If strict ARP learning is configured both globally and in the interface, the strict ARP learning configuration in the interface is used. 2)If strict ARP learning is not configured in the interface, the global strict ARP learning configuration is used.

route-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable routed proxy ARP. When two hosts reside on different network segments and do not have default gateways configured, IP address resolution between the two hosts can be implemented using routed proxy ARP.

inner-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable intra-VLAN proxy ARP. Some switches isolate hosts in the same VLAN. To allow hosts in the same VLAN to communicate, enable inner VLAN proxy ARP.

inter-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable inter VLAN proxy ARP. If hosts in different VLANs need to communicate at L2, enable inter VLAN proxy ARP on an interface. Hosts between sub VLANs in a super VLAN cannot communicate by default. To allow these hosts to communicate, enable inter VLAN proxy ARP on the VLAN interface of the super VLAN.

local-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable local proxy ARP. To allow isolated hosts in a bridge domain (BD) to communicate with each other, enable local proxy ARP. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

fake-expire-time.description: Aging time of a fake ARP entry.

probe-unicast.description: Enable/disable to send unicast ARP aging probe messages for a dynamic ARP entry.

dest-mac-check.description: Enable/disable to check destination MAC addresses in ARP messages.

src-mac-check.description: Enable/disable to check source MAC addresses in ARP messages.

distribute-enable.description: Enable/disable to distribute gateway. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

gratuitous-send.description: Enable/disable to send gratuitous ARP packet on interface.

host-collect-enable.description: Enable/disable the host information collection function. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

anyway-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable anyway proxy ARP. When two hosts reside on different network segments and do not have default gateways configured, IP address resolution between the two hosts can be implemented using anyway proxy ARP.

generate-rdtbl-enable.description: Enable/disable the configuration of generate rd table. It's mutually exclusive with the configuration of enable L2 proxy under the corresponding BD instance.

broadcast-detect-interval.description: Configure the broadcast detect interval. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

broadcast-detect-times.description: Configure the broadcast detect times. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

broadcast-detect-enable.description: Enable/disable the configuration of broadcast detect. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

fake-penalty-time.description: Aging penalty time of a fake ARP entry.

gratuitous-arp-drop.description: Enable/disable an interface to discard gratuitous ARP packets.

broadcast-max-num.description: Maximum broadcast packet sending rate, expressed in the number of packets sent per second.

smart-discover-enable.description: Enable/disable ARP smart discover. Only VLANIF interfaces are supported.

l2-sub-interface.description: Configure ARP security configuration on Layer 2 sub-interface.

l2proxy-dyn-learn.description: Enable/disable dynamic ARP learning of L2 proxy ARP.

l2proxy-max-num.description: Maximum number of ARP entries allowed for L2 proxy ARP.

reuse.description: Reusing threshold of an interface. The value must be smaller than the suppression threshold.

ceiling.description: Maximum suppression value on an interface. The value should be greater than the damping suppression threshold.

decay-ng.description: The penalty value of a Down interface attenuates to 1/2.

trunk_schema.description: Configure the trunk bundling technology that bundles multiple physical interfaces into a logical interface.

min-up-num.description: Specify the minimum number of Up member links of a trunk interface.

min-up-bandwidth.description: Specify the minimum bandwidth of Up member links of a trunk interface.

max-up-num.description: Maximum number of links that affect the actual bandwidth of the Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface.

type.description: Specify the trunk interface types. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types.

hash-type.description: Configure the hash algorithm for a forwarding table.

work-mode.description: Configure the working mode for a trunk interface.

smart-link-flush-vlan.description: Specify the ID of the VLAN to which Smart-link flush packets are sent. Only Layer 2 interface supports the node.

inactive-port-shutdown.description:
Enable/disable the laser auto shutdown function on the backup interface of the Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode.
After this function is enabled, the backup interface will be shut down. By default, the laser auto shutdown function is disabled.

preempt-enable.description:
Enable/disable delay switchback for the master member interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode. By default, this function is disabled. This function works together with revert delay time that can be configured only after this function is enabled.
After this function is enabled, the restored master interface automatically takes over traffic of the backup interface when the revert delay time expires.

preempt-delay-minutes.description:
Specify the delay interval (in minutes) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-seconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-milliseconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in million-seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

arp-entry_schema.description: Configure ARP interface, including the aging time, probe interval, number of aging probe attempts, dynamic ARP learning status, strict ARP learning status, and routed proxy.

expire-time.description: Aging time of a dynamic ARP entry.

probe-interval.description: Interval for detecting dynamic ARP entries.

probe-times.description: Number of aging probe attempts for a dynamic ARP entry. If a device does not receive an ARP reply message after the number of aging probe attempts reaches a specified number, the dynamic ARP entry is deleted.

arp-learn-disable.description: Enable/disable dynamic ARP learning. If the value is true, dynamic ARP learning is disabled. If the value is false, dynamic ARP learning is enabled.

arp-learn-strict.description: Enable strict ARP learning. After strict ARP learning is enabled, a device only learns address information of only the ARP reply message in response to the ARP request sent by itself. Strict ARP learning employs the longest match rule. 1)If strict ARP learning is configured both globally and in the interface, the strict ARP learning configuration in the interface is used. 2)If strict ARP learning is not configured in the interface, the global strict ARP learning configuration is used.

route-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable routed proxy ARP. When two hosts reside on different network segments and do not have default gateways configured, IP address resolution between the two hosts can be implemented using routed proxy ARP.

inner-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable intra-VLAN proxy ARP. Some switches isolate hosts in the same VLAN. To allow hosts in the same VLAN to communicate, enable inner VLAN proxy ARP.

inter-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable inter VLAN proxy ARP. If hosts in different VLANs need to communicate at L2, enable inter VLAN proxy ARP on an interface. Hosts between sub VLANs in a super VLAN cannot communicate by default. To allow these hosts to communicate, enable inter VLAN proxy ARP on the VLAN interface of the super VLAN.

local-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable local proxy ARP. To allow isolated hosts in a bridge domain (BD) to communicate with each other, enable local proxy ARP. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

fake-expire-time.description: Aging time of a fake ARP entry.

probe-unicast.description: Enable/disable to send unicast ARP aging probe messages for a dynamic ARP entry.

dest-mac-check.description: Enable/disable to check destination MAC addresses in ARP messages.

src-mac-check.description: Enable/disable to check source MAC addresses in ARP messages.

distribute-enable.description: Enable/disable to distribute gateway. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

gratuitous-send.description: Enable/disable to send gratuitous ARP packet on interface.

host-collect-enable.description: Enable/disable the host information collection function. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

anyway-proxy-enable.description: Enable/disable anyway proxy ARP. When two hosts reside on different network segments and do not have default gateways configured, IP address resolution between the two hosts can be implemented using anyway proxy ARP.

generate-rdtbl-enable.description: Enable/disable the configuration of generate rd table. It's mutually exclusive with the configuration of enable L2 proxy under the corresponding BD instance.

broadcast-detect-interval.description: Configure the broadcast detect interval. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

broadcast-detect-times.description: Configure the broadcast detect times. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

broadcast-detect-enable.description: Enable/disable the configuration of broadcast detect. Only VBD interfaces are supported.

fake-penalty-time.description: Aging penalty time of a fake ARP entry.

gratuitous-arp-drop.description: Enable/disable an interface to discard gratuitous ARP packets.

broadcast-max-num.description: Maximum broadcast packet sending rate, expressed in the number of packets sent per second.

smart-discover-enable.description: Enable/disable ARP smart discover. Only VLANIF interfaces are supported.

l2-sub-interface.description: Configure ARP security configuration on Layer 2 sub-interface.

l2proxy-dyn-learn.description: Enable/disable dynamic ARP learning of L2 proxy ARP.

l2proxy-max-num.description: Maximum number of ARP entries allowed for L2 proxy ARP.

arp_schema.description: Address resolution protocol (ARP) management, which includes static ARP configuration, dynamic ARP learning, ARP security configuration, ARP entry query, and packet statistics collection.

strict-learn-enable.description: Enable/disable strict ARP learning so that a device learns only address information carried in the ARP reply messages in response to the ARP Request messages sent by itself.

l2topo-detect-enable.description: Enable/disable L2 topology probe. After a L2 interface goes up, the device updates all ARP entries corresponding to the VLAN to which the L2 interface belongs.

rate-trap-interval.description: Interval at which ARP logs and traps are recorded. If the value is 0, logs and traps are not recorded.

passive-learn-enable.description: Enable/disable passive ARP learning. After the backup device in a VRRP backup group receives an ARP request message destined for the virtual IP address, the backup device learns the ARP entry of the requester.

con-send-enable.description: Enable/disable ARP packet sending at a limited rate.

con-send-maxnum.description: Maximum packet sending rate, expressed in the number of packets send every 10 ms.

gratuitous-drop.description: Enable/disable the function to discard gratuitous ARP packets.

vlanif-expiretime.description: Aging time of a dynamic ARP entry of VLAN interface.

host-conflict-period.description: Period configurations for the host conflict.

host-conflict-threshold.description: Retry times configurations for the host conflict.

smart-discover-interval.description: Set the interval for sending ARP probe packets.

smart-discover-count.description: Set the number of ARP probe packets sent in each interval. The count is an integer that ranges from 1 to 512 with the step of 8. For example, the value can be 1, 8, 16.

speed-limits.description: List of timestamp suppression rate at which an interface board suppresses ARP messages.

speed-limit.description: Configure timestamp suppression rate at which an interface board suppresses ARP messages.

slot-id.description: Slot ID, which refers to the position of logical MPU board and physical LPU boards. When Slot ID refering MPU board, the value of slot-id is 0.

suppress-type.description: Suppression type. The available options are ARP and ARP miss.

ip-type.description: Suppression type based on IP addresses. The available options are destination IP suppression and source IP suppression. Destination IP suppression maps to ARP suppression. Source IP suppression maps to ARP miss suppression.

suppress-value.description: Number of ARP messages or ARP miss messages that an interface can process in a specified period.

static-arps.description: List of short static ARP configurations, not depend on the interface.

static-arp.description: Configure static ARP table. By default, the system ARP table is empty, and address mappings are obtained using dynamic ARP.

ip-addr.description: IP address, in dotted decimal notation.

ni-name.description: Name of the VPN instance to which an ARP entry belongs, which refers to network instance name.

mac-addr.description: MAC address in the format of H-H-H, in which H is a hexadecimal number of 1 to 4 bits.

vlan-id.description: VLAN ID. If this parameter is not set, the VLAN ID is considered to be 0. If this parameter is set, the ARP entry is in the specified VLAN.

query-entry.description: Statistics of query ARP entries, including static, dynamic, and interface-based ARP entries.
